raw_comment:
I notice that globally, all sources of electricity generation are increasing, as can be depicted by the world electricity generation graph. Currently, it looks like global source of energy production through clean methods are being utilized at similar rates to fossil fuel sources. 

I wonder what countries most largely contribute focus on using clean energy sources being that the break down of China, United States, and India show that these 3 countries rely mostly on fossil fuels.  I also wonder what the color scale means, aside from differentiating the different groups - Is coal the worst fossil fuel as it is put on the bottom and the darkest, and is Nuclear the cleanest source as it is on the top of the clean category and the lightest in color.

This is impactful as it makes my community and I aware of where we are getting our power from, and can possibly incentive the advocacy for more focus on clean energy production

Headline: Changing Global Sources of Energy
ace_sentences: I notice that all sources of electricity generation increase globally.
A world electricity generation graph depicts this increase.
Currently, clean methods and fossil-fuel methods are utilized at similar rates for global energy production.
I wonder which countries contribute most to the use of clean energy sources.
A breakdown of China shows that China relies mostly on fossil fuels.
A breakdown of the United States shows that the United States relies mostly on fossil fuels.
A breakdown of India shows that India relies mostly on fossil fuels.
I wonder what the color scale means.
The color scale differentiates different groups.
I wonder whether coal is the worst fossil fuel.
Coal is at the bottom of the fossil-fuel category.
Coal is the darkest in the fossil-fuel category.
I wonder whether nuclear energy is the cleanest source.
Nuclear energy is at the top of the clean category.
Nuclear energy is the lightest in the clean category.
This information is impactful.
This information makes my community aware of where my community gets power from.
This information makes me aware of where I get power from.
This awareness can incentivize advocacy for more focus on clean energy production.
The headline is: Changing Global Sources of Energy.
